utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. At least 90,000 residents have been ordered to evacuate towns near a massive Northern California wildfire. utterances.speaker: JOE MACHI, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: I'm not a fan of those, Greg. Sometimes there's just no other good way to say that you don't like someone. If all we have left -- if they take away insult words like the B word, which I don't want to say right now. All that's left is going to be sarcastic patronizing. Like I would have to say things like, Greg, you look great today. Have you gotten taller?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: That was just for instance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You probably had other ones you could have chosen, but you chose that one instead. What do you -- what else you've got? What you're your thoughts about the attacks on Trump about his tweeting?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: Oh, well, you know, I mean -- Tyrus, back me up on this one. I've got my finger on the pulse of black America.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: They are not upset about people using hyperbole.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: People understand that it's an exaggeration of something bad and lynching in this instance, Trump meant it to be bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: If he meant it to be good, then I could see how people would be kind of offended by that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a fair point. The pulse on black America, Joe Machi. I see a special segment for you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Kat, anything you want to talk about?

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, I just -- you kind of insinuated with Joe Biden using the word lynching as well that he was being hypocritical and in most cases, I'd agree. With Joe Biden, I think it's more that he doesn't always know like, what he is saying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Which I think actually if he does get the nomination will make it very difficult for Trump to debate him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like, not because he's good at it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: But because he's so bad. Like it's really hard to actually attack someone when they don't know what they're saying. Like Trump could be up there making his argument, making good points. Biden's turn to respond. He just goes, table for four, please.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Everyone's like, dear God, he thinks he is at Benihana again. And it's really hard to attack someone who thinks they are at Benihana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that is true. That is you. Tyrus, what are your thoughts? GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, CONTRIBUTOR: Well, I've got to be honest, seeing people outraged at a group of white men walking around Washington was pretty fun for me.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Times have changed. My God, get the kids in the car. Why? What's wrong? There's a group of white men. Let's go. Let's go. Everyone in the car. Who knows what they're going to do?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lock the doors. Cross the street.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: There might be awkward hellos.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Offers to pay for lunch. Weird ways of ending conversations. Weird handshakes. Do I hug you? Do I shake your hand? Ah. So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They might fist bump.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes -- no, they won't. I don't want to offend them, but it's just crazy to me that -- and only a group of white men could politely walk into a room. Excuse me, we're pro -- we're here -- we're going to sit down. Any other group, the police would have been there. I mean, that's where we're at now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: This is classic -- if anyone has ever played poker, there's always that one guy in the room who let everybody know, I have a really good hand. I have a really good hand. And then he doesn't know why everyone folds.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And then he finally plays and he loses because he is saying -- the Democrats, you don't want to play your hand. Supposedly, when all this happened, they had the phone call.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They were like catch a predator. We have the transcripts. All we need is the transcripts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: We can impeach off the transcript. Well, and then well, make a move. But they don't because we might be able to find something more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: We're going to keep going. We're going to keep digging. We're going to stretch this out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And while you're stretching it out, impeach what? And then go ahead impeach.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Make a move, but they won't because it's not about impeachment. They have two goals. They're going to besmirch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Which is a B word that should be outlawed. The President as much as they can for as long as they can try to affect his election and get rid of that old white man, Biden at the same time. That's what this is really about.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Good point.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: This is about getting rid of him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It is a black guy and Biden, nepotism with his son, he is just as bad as Trump, so he's got to go. It has nothing to do with anything else but that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is brilliant. I'm going to end on that analysis.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Up next, the Democrats -- who is the top seed and who is on weed? Next.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: And now, The Greg Gutfeld Show presents, the 2020 CAN'T-idates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mayor Pete concedes to smoking weed. He's in favor of decriminalization, not just of pot, but all drugs. This week he toured a marijuana grow house. I love that. A Reuter reporter asked if he's ever partaken.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.utterance: Do you have people in your life who consistently use marijuana? Have you used it yourself?

utterances.speaker: PETE BUTTIGIEG, D-IND., MAYOR, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I have a handful of times a long time ago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A handful of times. What technically is a handful? I guess, I'll find out tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Pete. But if Pete is saying, I experimented. Yes, you were real Galileo with that eighth ball. Meanwhile, the Democratic establishment is getting anxious about their candidates and they're starting to ask is there anybody else? At least that's what I read in an article titled, "Anxious Democratic Establishment Ask If There's Anybody Else?" Apparently, they are worried Biden is not raising enough cash and Warren may not be able to beat Trump. They wonder if Mike Bloomberg is a better candidate, or yes once again, Hillary. Hillary's top adviser says don't rule her out yet, while other Dems say this about Hillary.

utterances.speaker: BRYAN DEAN WRIGHT, FORMER C.I.A. OFFICER
utterances.utterance: She makes me want to drink. It's very early and I don't drink.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was funny. So is there anybody else? Damn, that is a good question.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Can't get excited about the current crop of Democrats running for President? Well, not to worry because we searched the world and found plenty of impressive candidates, like this lazy horse who plays dead whenever someone tries to ride him. A dog who will not be held by any fence. A rat who could drive a car. A rat dragging pizza. A cockroach smoking a cigarette. My Uncle Steve who lost his hand mixing Margarita is in a wood chipper. My other uncle Steve who looks exactly like Guy Fieri. A cat whose mind is blown every time he gets in a car. Matthew McConaughey's abs. Channing Tatum's abs. Michael Moore's abs. Whoops. Sorry. A guy who pushes the limits of what is acceptable in public on a pogo stick and a sea lion who sounds like Howard Dean. Oh yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Joe, is it too late for Democrats to start thinking about a different candidate? Or do you think that they got the candidate already?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: I almost think it's too early to start talking about is it too late for someone to run in 2020? But I guess 20 isn't enough. We should start looking for who doesn't want to be President and see who can be President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Whittle it down from there. Start at like 6.3 billion and then work backwards. Tyrus, thoughts on anybody else? No one else?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I feel like if I was coaching them that I would be in trouble for yelling and cussing a lot and throwing my clipboard. Buttigieg had a moment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I know you're the Emperor, the evil empire that is Lord President Trump. If you haven't learned anything from him, he is brash. He takes chances. Buttigieg -- do you smoke weed? What? If would have done that. What do you think? If would have done that, it would be like, damn, he has got -- man, well, he's got it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: But instead, he's a Democrat. A handful of times, I might have experimented, but I'm very sorry and if you're okay with it, I'm happy that you're okay with it. I'm okay with it, but I'm very sorry. And it was like a handful of times. Like one hand, not a full. It was more like two fingers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Two fingers.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It was half a blunt. I don't know if that's the right terminology. But I just like to say I'm very, very sorry if anyone was offended or hurt by my possible use of more than less than a half ounce of weed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat? Why is it when everybody talks about weed, they come off as phony? Why can't they do what Tyrus says? Just be normal?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Light up?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes. Because they lie. But it's weird because like normally they lie about, you know, only a little bit or, you know, no I didn't or I didn't inhale. Kamala Harris of course went the opposite route and lied about smoking it when clearly she never did.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's weird. I never, you know, took that route when I was a kid. Mom, I smoked so much weed. I'm grounded. But I never smoked any weed. Like, I don't get that. But in terms of another candidate, the one person I hear all these people bringing up all the time is Michelle Obama.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right, right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: This month, a poll actually came out and said that if she were to enter the race, she would immediately enter as the front runner. So people were talking about it. This is great. She would be the front runner. That's great. One problem. She doesn't want to run. Yes, she said there is a zero percent chance I will run. That's kind of a big problem. Like why did you even do this poll? Like that would be like a guy being like, I found the perfect woman. She's the best. I want to marry her. I want her to have my kids, just one problem -- restraining order.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I would give the same advice to the Democratic donors that are having this discussion as I would give to that guy, you know, you need to settle and look at your current options and get one of them pregnant.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How beautiful. Pete, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: What's the one thing you want when you've lost and you thought you should have won?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Tequila.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You want to rematch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And I think that's what Hillary Clinton wants.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And she doesn't care whether she is the most electable of the group.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: She is sitting back, watching the dumpster fire realizing the leftist can't win and Joe Biden can't raise money because no one wants to vote for Joe Biden at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And she is saying, I think I can take these guys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And she is legitimately flirting with the idea. And she thinks if I can do this one more time, this time, you know, the Russians won't do it to me again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I mean, I it's scary. But Bloomberg or Hillary? As the saviors over the Hill. It's insane.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Here's my theory. They can't tell Bernie and Liz and Joe to go home because that's -- they're going to have to put her on the front of the line. Joe picks her as VP, and then he drops out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just want to do this whole -- I heard that from this guy. He whispered it in my ear. My friend. There's still stuff on it. Up next. Should he have been canned or caned for climbing on cars. That's next.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. At least 90,000 residents have been ordered to evacuate towns near a massive Northern California wildfire. This as the state's power company just announced outages for more than two million people because of a historic wind event and extreme fire danger. The latest round of blackouts is being implemented in stages impacting nearly a million homes and businesses in 36 counties. Firefighters are battling deadly wildfires across that state. Meantime, the woman convicted of conspiring to act as an agent for a foreign state in the U.S. is back again in Russia tonight. Maria Butina landed in Moscow one day after she was released from a Federal prison in Florida and deported. Butina tried to infiltrate conservative political groups including the NRA to promote Russian interests. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to The Greg Gutfeld Show.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: He's gone for good after banging the hood. A local reporter in Sacramento -- aren't they all -- had one job, take your camera crew, go to the Auto Show, do a live report on all the pretty cars and try to treat the expensive highly cherished vehicles with a modicum of respect. He didn't.

utterances.speaker: ANGEL CARDENAS, REPORTER
utterances.utterance: No one is out here to tell me which car I can't go in because you know some of these are off limits. So, I'm just going to -- I'm going to live on the wild side. So what do you think about this pose right here, Tina? Right here on the Thunberbird.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Oh no.

utterances.speaker: CARDENAS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I hit that other car.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Angel.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Oh no. Are you kidding?

utterances.speaker: CARDENAS
utterances.utterance: Nobody is looking. Look, hold on, save zoom in here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Leave your name and number.

utterances.speaker: CARDENAS
utterances.utterance: It's not dented and there's no pink.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Leave your name and number on the dashboard.

utterances.speaker: CARDENAS
utterances.utterance: Hold on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So he's fired.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The station had to apologize, but it could be worse, he could be this guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'd rather be that guy. Tyrus? Do you blame the guy? Would you -- does he deserve to be fired?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Hell yes, he deserves to be fired. This is kind of our fault.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Everybody wants to be entertaining and funny and drop a little news. Now, everyone wants to steal a -- you're a reporter. Your job is to report the news, not to be part of the story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: But I guess that's the way we do it now. Everyone is a part of the story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: This is boring. You're a reporter. You're supposed to be boring. You're supposed to come out there and give us information about a freaking car show. That's all you're supposed to do. Nobody needed this not sexy, creepy pose of you on the car. That's not news. That's crap you do on your Instagram that nobody looks at.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: This is what's wrong with reporters today. You know, they -- at the White House, they are the story. I got in a fight with the President today. You're not supposed to. He is supposed to be the story.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: You can't say that. You can't say that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I am not in Massachusetts.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Oh, okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Pete, he is kind of talking about you. I would say -- I would say I wouldn't blame the jerk trying to be you. I blame -- the responsibility is the car show organizers who let the TV crew do exactly what they wanted because oh, it's TV. Oh, we've got to let him in and let them do whatever they want.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I would argue they had probably done more car segments.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Than anyone on this couch with "Fox and Friends" like every other weekend, we've got a car segment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: It's never occurred to me to jump on the hood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I mean, maybe on the back of a pickup truck where people normally stand. Yes, this is a guy who is probably bored with this job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Probably loves himself a little bit more than he should. He wants to entertain the ladies who were laughing on the other side of the camera in studio.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I hope they got fired, too. Sorry. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: But I disagree with you. I don't think he should be fired at all. He didn't harm the cars. I mean, maybe he --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry, Pete, I'm just going to call you out. If you walked out your house and that guy was sitting on the front of your truck on a mic going, hey, check it out. Oh, I scratched the hood. How is that going to turn out? You high five him?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: But I don't own a classic car.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, I do and I would have killed him.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But you know, here's my thing. Well, Joe, I want to get your opinion because -- do you sympathize with him?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: I feel bad he lost his job. He was trying to be funny. And as someone who has posed in a number of car calendars that's not how you do it.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: But the only part that I thought was silly was where he said, well, no one is here to tell us what we can and can't do. And it made me think of all those, when you buy something in a plastic bag, it says, don't put this over your head.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: Why do we need that sign? It's because of guys like this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And he is saying, hey, I'm not going to get caught. He is saying this in front of cameras like nobody is watching. We're not filming this, Kat. Whose side are you on?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I struggle with this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you struggle?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Because -- I understand the temptation. Every time I'm on TV to just wild out, like the other day I was on "Cavuto" and he asked me a question about Brexit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And what I did was answer the question, but what I wanted to do was just be like meow.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You know like, meow, meow -- and just start crawling on the table.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. You should do that.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I know, but the thing is -- but -- so on that part, I understand, but then I also am not on his side because if I did that, I would destroy my career. I would destroy my dignity. But at least those things are mine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You know, that car not his.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, you're right. You know, this is a lesson, never leave your stuff unguarded when you have talent around because they feel entitled to do anything to get the shot. Oh, can we move granny on life support away from the window because we'd like to get some natural light. We'll just unplug her.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I have to charge my phone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, can I charge my phone, Granny. Do you believein ghosts and demons? We report. You run and hide.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Demons and ghosts, who believes the most? A survey by YouGov finds that 45 percent of Americans believe that demons and ghosts exist, but only 13 percent think vampires exist. Probably because they suck.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, stop it. Nothing though about goblins, which seems goblinist. Then of course, because everything has to be political these days, the survey found Republicans were more likely to believe in spirits than Dems, too bad for you, disbelievers. You don't get to play with the world's largest Ouija board. Yes, right now, it's in Salem, Massachusetts. But I'm renting it out for my pajama party next weekend. We're going to contact Abe Lincoln. I wonder what Abe Lincoln is doing these days?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Must be a different Abe Lincoln. Kat, do you believe in ghosts? Are they friendly ghosts like Casper or not?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Well, okay, so my mom was really Catholic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: When someone says they're Catholic, I'm like, are you sure? She was very Catholic. It was a huge part of the way I was raised. So in some ways, raised in the normal way, like, you know, wash your hands after you go to the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's Catholic.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Don't pick your nose. No, but then there was other stuff like, if you play with Ouija board, the devil will possess your soul.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And I was so scared. I remember, I was at a sleep over party once and the girls there, they pulled out one of these and I was like, is it going to happen for me being in the same room with it? Like I was so scared, I thought it was made by the devil himself. Now, I realized it made by Hasbro.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: But I'm still a little scared of it. So wherever you are out in the universe, mom, good on you. It worked.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is actually amazing, Joe, that like I grew up with a Ouija board and it's scared everybody. How did they make any money?

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: I don't know. It's ridiculous. It's a ridiculous invention, I always would -- I would always move it to say one of the other people at the sleep over was a loser.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: But this whole survey is ridiculous because it added things together that really weren't all that similar. Because if you believe in religion, now I'm Catholic, and, you know, you can say that God is supernatural, but vampires are purely fiction. And then it had aliens as the same category as supernatural. And no, by definition, aliens are in the universe just because we haven't empirically proven them yet, I mean, but I don't know. It just seemed a little dumb to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, that's on you for reading the actual source material. Generally -- generally, our guests don't do that, Joe.

utterances.speaker: MACHI
utterances.utterance: Waste some time here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're wasting time. Tyrus, you have any Ouija board memories?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No, I'm black.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Not in our neighborhood, bro. We got real problems.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You don't need to conjure up any other.
